column2: it needs to be considered in the totality of evidence that is in the light of
the evidence for the prosecution as well as the defence. ‚Äù
In this case, I am of the view that the learned trial Judge has failed to give due
consideration  to  the  defence  evidence  and  unfairly  rejected  the  same.  The
prosecution has failed to prove the charges beyond reasonable doubt.
On the above premise, I find that the grounds of appeal urged by the appellant
have merit and the appeal should succeed.  Accused is acquitted of all charges.
